page.title: 01Central lowland of Lleyn
page.content: The area is bisected by the old Turnpike, & a smaller road runs parallel, 1km northward, giving access to small famrs & cottage-holdings, most supplementing their meagre income by letting to summer visitors. Properties have standard amenities but retain the old fabric of stone walls, Welsh slate roofs, & small windows. Sheep graze the land primarily, plus some store cattle. Fields are small, delineated by ancient gorse-topped stone walls. There is an intensive egg-producing poultry farm, & a sizeable piggery. The two conifer plantations (Forestry Commission) are now reaching maturity & felling has commenced. The main industrial unit is a farming co-operative, retailing machinery, animal foodstuffs & fuel. There is also a woodyard.
